help.title: Reference Type System
help.description: The reference system uses a combination of letters to categorize references:

types.title: Types
types.R: Rolling - Levels where the primary technique in difficult sections is rolling.
types.I: Indexing - Levels that require high speed (>= 190 BPM) indexing and/or long periods of indexing.
types.T: Tech - Levels that require unique or non-traditional methods of hitting patterns, usually as a result of complex polyrhythms, long accelerations / decelerations, or unintuitive rhythms
types.K: Keycount - Levels that contain a significant amount of high keycount (12K and 16K) play. Typically comes in conjunction with another tag.
types.K+: Keycount+ - Levels that contain an extremely high amount of keycount (16K+) play or complex keycount patterns.

editMode.placeholder: Enter level IDs separated by commas

help.title: Reference Type System - Edit Mode
help.description: The reference system uses a combination of letters to categorize references:

types.title: Types
types.R: Rolling - Levels where the primary technique in difficult sections is rolling.
types.I: Indexing - Levels that require high speed (>= 190 BPM) indexing and/or long periods of indexing.
types.T: Tech - Levels that require unique or non-traditional methods of hitting patterns, usually as a result of complex polyrhythms, long accelerations / decelerations, or unintuitive rhythms
types.K: Keycount - Levels that contain a significant amount of high keycount (12K and 16K) play. Typically comes in conjunction with another tag.
types.K+: Keycount+ - Levels that contain an extremely high amount of keycount (16K+) play or complex keycount patterns.

rules.title: Rules
list: Each line can have one type prefix
Types can be combined (e.g., RI, TK)
Level IDs must be separated by commas
Untyped references go on their own line
